Module ehubicka.scheduler
Package ehubicka.Controller

Class Report

java.lang.Object
ehubicka.Controller.Report
public class Report extends Object
This class will display three separate reports. These reports do not print or export anything, but rather serve as supplemental information.

  • Constructor Details

    • Report

      public Report()

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      Used to initialize the controller with any code that needs to be implemented when this screen is accessed. The first report will display the amount of appointments scheduled based on appointment type and month. The second report displays associated appointments with each contact. The third report will show how long each customer's associated appointments will take.

    • onBackClick

      public void onBackClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      Users are taken back to the mainscreen.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the back button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - most likely if FXMLLoader.load() can't find the .fxml file.

    • appointmentCountOnAction

      public void appointmentCountOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      A lambda expression is used to map customer appointments counts and the numerical value of their respective start date months. The lambda simplifies the function. The function without the lambda is left commented out to show the difference in code. The selected contact will have its number of appointments in each month displayed in a text area. This is associated with the first report.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the appointment type combo box is changed.

    • contactSelectOnAction

      public void contactSelectOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Populates the appointment table used in the second report. Appointments are filtered based on which contact is selected from the combo box.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the contact combo box is changed.

    • customerSelectOnAction

      public void customerSelectOnAction(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Populates the associated text area with appointment ID's and their respective appointment lengths. The results are filtered based on which customer is selected from the combo box. This is associated with the third report.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - when the customer combo box is changed.
